title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 March 2014 - XWiki

10:06 <cjd> GET http://ads.panoramtech.net/loader.js?client=tac net::ERR\_BLOCKED\_BY\_CLIENT  
10:06 <cjd> on playground.xwiki.org  
10:07 <cjd> I'm pretty sure that's not supposed to be there...  
10:09 <sbaloul> has quit  
10:11 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <vmassol> sbaloul: @  
10:21 <vmassol> oops  
10:21 <vmassol> sbaloul: hi  
10:21 <vmassol> have you released the forum app and updated the forum app page?  
10:21 <sbaloul> Hi vmassol  
10:22 <vmassol> it's taking too long sbaloul  
10:22 <sbaloul> I have released the forum but I've not updated the forum page yet  
10:22 <vmassol> no you haven't released it  
10:22 <vmassol> you didn't read the documentation fully  
10:23 <hhhannes> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <vmassol> as I told you yesterday on irc  
10:23 <vmassol> I can see a lot of staging repos  
10:23 <vmassol> about 14  
10:23 <vmassol> http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/index.html#stagingRepositories  
10:23 <vmassol> what are they? what do you want to do with them?  
10:24 <vmassol> to release a version it needs to be promoted out of staging  
10:24 <vmassol> as you can see on http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/forum/application-forum/ your version is not released  
10:24 <vmassol> this is all documented  
10:24 <tmortagne> sbaloul: looks like you executed release:perform many times  
10:25 <tmortagne> (I'm surprise it did not go in the same staging)  
10:26 <tmortagne> most of them are actually almost empty  
10:26 <sbaloul> vmassol what's the last goal to execute to get  a release done  
10:26 <vmassol> sbaloul: again you need to READ the documentation  
10:26 <vmassol> http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HReleasetheproject  
10:26 <sbaloul> the last goal I executed is mvn release:perform  
10:27 <vmassol> what's your user id on nexus?  
10:27 <tmortagne> some have the source, some have the pom  
10:27 <sbaloul> sbaloul  
10:27 <tmortagne> I don't understand what happen  
10:27 <vmassol> did you read this: " • Ask for someone to promote your release (ie. make it available on maven.xwiki.org) in the thread you've created earlier  
10:27 <vmassol> " • After that your release will be available for download on maven.xwiki.org and anyone will be able to use it as a dependency for his own project  
10:27 <vmassol> "  
10:28 <sbaloul> no, but I got stuck in mvn release:perform  
10:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: none of those staging are correct  
10:28 <tmortagne> not even the last one  
10:28 <vmassol> I could give you the rights to promote a release but since you're still young, maybe we should wait a bit and let others do the promotion for now  
10:28 <vmassol> ok removing all  
10:28 <vmassol> please redo the release  
10:28 <tmortagne> I have no idea how it's possible to end up with that  
10:28 <vmassol> you need to call mvn release:rollback probably  
10:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: as I said on irc yesterday I don't know how sofiane could have cretaed 1 repo every 2-3 seconds  
10:29 <vmassol> :)  
10:29 <vmassol> removing all now  
10:29 <tmortagne> sounds like a bug somewhere  
10:29 <sbaloul> I executed mvn release:perform (without executing release:prepare)  
10:29 <vmassol> done  
10:29 <tmortagne> maybe not sbaloul fault (even if he forgot asking for promoting the repo)  
10:30 <vmassol> sbaloul: please do again but you'll need to rollback first  
10:30 <sbaloul> ok  
10:30 <tmortagne> sbaloul: are you releasing from windows ?  
10:30 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/maven-release/maven-release-plugin/examples/rollback-release.html  
10:30 <vmassol> no he's releasing from ubuntu  
10:31 <tmortagne> maybe there is a nexus bug, did we upgraded it recently ?  
10:31 <sbaloul> no I'm releasing from ubuntu  
10:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: no  
10:33 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <spu7nic> Greetings :)  
10:36 <vmassol> hi SK  
10:39 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <hhhannes> hello, i installed xwiki 5.4.2 with mysql and i always receive an error message when i try to create new wikis with the gui. the message is "Wiki "" creation failed: org.xwiki.wiki.manager.WikiManagerException: Failed to create database for wiki". are there special rights i need to grant to the xwiki mysql user? i think this user already has been granted ALL privileges  
10:42 <tmortagne> hhhannes: granting ALL priviliges on "xwiki" database won't help, a new wiki is a new database so the user need to have the right to create new databases  
10:45 <tmortagne> hhhannes: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL#HInstallationSteps  
10:53 <sbaloul> vmassol : mvn release:rollback fails because I have run release:clean before (backup files and the release descriptor from the previous release are removed)  
10:53 <sbaloul> I have to rollback changes manually  
10:54 <vmassol> don't forget to remove the tag in git  
10:55 <sbaloul> yes I know, locally no problem I can do a rollback for changes but in github I've never do it  
10:55 <sbaloul> I've never done it  
10:55 <vmassol> http://nathanhoad.net/how-to-delete-a-remote-git-tag  
10:55 <hhhannes> +mortagne: thanks, i followed these instructions already and tried different things now like replacing localhost by 127.0.0.1, flushing privileges and restarting mysqld. now it works and i do not know the root cause for the problem. anyway, great thing  
10:56 <sbaloul> thanks vmassol :)  
10:57 <hhhannes> +tmortagne: is there a way to clone all installed extensions into the new wiki i create?  
10:58 <tmortagne> hhhannes: you can create a wiki template and create new wikis from it, wiki template extension will be copied in the new one  
11:01 <hhhannes> +tmortagne: yes, i saw this. is it possible to convert a wiki to a template when it already exists? or only at the point of creation?  
11:01 <tmortagne> yep  
11:01 <tmortagne> being a template is just declaring that a wiki is one  
11:01 <tmortagne> go the the wiki index and then the wiki descriptor  
11:02 <tmortagne> and there should be some UI to make it a template  
11:02 <tmortagne> depends on your XWiki version  
11:02 <tmortagne> ha 5.4.2 right  
11:04 <hhhannes> +tmortagne: yep, 5.4.2  
11:04 <tmortagne> then you have Home -> Wiki index  
11:04 <tmortagne> find the wiki you want to make a template wiki in there  
11:05 <tmortagne> and there should be some UI to do it  
11:10 <spu7nic> Is it possible to use a numeric field as the id field for a DBList reference?  
11:14 <fmancinelli> has quit  
11:16 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <hhhannes> has quit  
11:25 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <Slashman> has quit  
11:28 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <sbaloul> to rollback remote changes, I've created a new branch called saved-master (origin) and I tried to remove the master (origin) to move it to the right commit  
11:48 <sbaloul>  I got this error :  
11:49 <sbaloul> remote: error: refusing to delete the current branch: refs/heads/master  
11:49 <sbaloul>  ! [remote rejected] master (deletion of the current branch prohibited)  
11:49 <sbaloul> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-forum2/network  
11:50 <vmassol> you don't need any new branch to rollback changes!  
11:51 <sbaloul> new branch to not lose the master in case of mistakes  
11:51 <vmassol> git revert is enough  
11:51 <vmassol> there's no possible mistake since what you're doing is always local  
11:51 <vmassol> untill you push it  
11:52 <sbaloul> but I have to do changes lacally before remotelly  
11:54 <vmassol> and?  
11:54 <vmassol> git revert is local of course  
11:57 <sbaloul> I tried something like this http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1526794/git-rename-master-branch-for-both-local-and-remote-repository?answertab=active#tab-top  
11:57 <sbaloul> I've never used git revert  
11:57 <vmassol> just do simple things  
11:57 <vmassol> and google  
11:57 <sbaloul> I'm looking for how to use it  
11:57 <sbaloul> yes  
11:57 <vmassol> you'll find tons of epxplanation  
11:57 <vmassol> \*explanations  
11:57 <sbaloul> It's what I'm doing  
11:57 <vmassol> git revert is to … revert  
11:57 <vmassol> which is what you're trying to do :)  
12:11 <fmancinelli> has quit  
12:12 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <cjd> mflorea: I'm listening to 'xwiki:wysiwyg:showWysiwyg' but when I add a TOC macro, it doesn't seem to be triggered and the iframe is changed  
12:23 <cjd> is there something else I should be listening to?  
12:25 <mflorea> cjd: let me check  
12:51 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:55 <mflorea> cjd: the issue is that RefreshExecutable#onSuccess doesn't fire the showWysiwyg event.  
12:55 <mflorea> ActionEvent.fire(editor.getRichTextEditor().getTextArea(), "showWysiwyg");  
12:56 <mflorea> like this ^  
12:56 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-client/src/main/java/org/xwiki/gwt/wysiwyg/client/plugin/macro/exec/RefreshExecutable.java#L125  
12:56 <mflorea> but  
12:56 <mflorea> as you can see, it executes the RESET command  
12:57 <mflorea> brb  
12:59 <evalica> has quit  
12:59 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
13:07 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:16 <sbaloul> vmassol : I run release:prepare and passes successful, but release:perform fails with the following message http://hastebin.com/dowisukifo.avrasm  
13:16 <sbaloul> I've rerun release:perform and it passed succussfully  
13:16 <vmassol> ouch 14 repos on nexus again  
13:17 <vmassol> I'm OTP ATM  
13:17 <vmassol> (need 1 more hour, maybe someone else can try to release on your behalf to see if the problem can be reproduced or if it's your environment which is problematic)  
13:18 <sbaloul> ok  
13:19 <cjd> mflorea: thank you very much, this should be most helpful  
13:26 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-gwt/xwiki-platform-gwt-user/src/main/java/org/xwiki/gwt/user/client/ui/rta/cmd/SourcesCommandEvents.java  
13:26 <mflorea> so you can't catch the RESET command  
13:26 <cjd> that's what makes it fun :)  
13:26 <mflorea> the only option I see is to change the RefreshExecutable to fire the showWysiwyg action  
13:27 <mflorea> but you need to rebuild the editor  
13:27 <cjd> for the moment, I'll use a setTimeout to check if it has changed  
13:27 <mflorea> ok  
13:27 <cjd> at 100ms or so it should be cheap enough to leave running in prod and it's a nice backup plan even if we are getting the messages  
13:28 <cjd> if (ifr !== document.getElementById()) { ... should be really fast  
13:36 <polx> has quit  
13:43 <hhhannes> has joined #xwiki  
13:44 <hhhannes> hey there, i receive an error on startup of xwiki 5.4.2 now after cloning a wiki and moving some pages... it is about the ratings manager. "[main] ERROR ltRatingsManagerInitialization - Error while initializzing ratings class java.lang.NullPointerException: null"  
13:45 <hhhannes> is there any way to disable the extensions where the error occurs so that i am able to use the gui again?  
13:49 <spu7nic> Is it possible to tell the livetable via collumnProps to use fieldname\_value instead fieldname?  
13:56 <hhhannes> has quit  
13:56 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <evalica1> has quit  
14:03 <hhhannes> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <tmortagne> sbaloul: back, trying to release it on my side we'll see  
14:05 <tmortagne> it=forum app  
14:05 <vmassol> sbaloul: fyi some nice git tutorial: http://justinhileman.info/article/changing-history/ ;)  
14:05 <vmassol> (look at the last diagram!)  
14:06 <hhhannes> sorry, i was have been logged out of the channel and cannot see a history right now. can someone tell me if there has been an answer to my question regarding the startup issue with the rating extension? i posted it maybe 15 minutes ago  
14:06 <tmortagne> sbaloul: you should not push when release fail  
14:06 <tmortagne> I see release related commits https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-forum2/commits/master  
14:06 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <tmortagne> and revert is not the right thing to use IMO, cleaning all that  
14:08 <polx> has quit  
14:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: see last diagram on http://justinhileman.info/article/changing-history/ ;)  
14:08 <tmortagne> cleaned the history, trying to release now  
14:09 <msmeria> has quit  
14:09 <vmassol> pushed history should never be modified  
14:10 <tmortagne> for real things sure  
14:10 <vmassol> very  ncice: "do you hate them?" :)  
14:11 <vmassol> I guess that's what you answered  
14:14 <hhhannes> has quit  
14:15 <tmortagne> look like release plugin automatically push...  
14:17 <sbaloul> tmortagne : Ok  
14:18 <sbaloul> Yes, It's pushed automatically  
14:20 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <hhhannes> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <tmortagne> vmassol, sbaloul: release:perform worked well for me  
14:22 <tmortagne> look at last staging repository, all the others are from sbaloul  
14:23 <tmortagne> sbaloul: you said you had to execute release:perform twice to get one "working", right ?  
14:24 <mflorea> vmassol: what project type did you use when creating jira projects for contrib repos?  
14:24 <vmassol> basic  
14:24 <tmortagne> sbaloul: what version of maven and java are you using ?  
14:24 <mflorea> ok, tanks  
14:25 <mflorea> thanks  
14:25 <vmassol> you have 8-9 stuff to modify afterwards  
14:25 <tmortagne> mvn -version  
14:25 <vmassol> it's a pain  
14:25 <mflorea> basic probably means "Simple Issue Tracking"  
14:26 <tmortagne> sbaloul: forum app is now fully released  
14:26 <sbaloul> thanks tmortagne :)  
14:26 <sbaloul> java 6 and maven 3  
14:26 <tmortagne> but I did not had any kind of issue whatsoever  
14:27 <mflorea> vmassol: basic doesn't have bug issue type by default? :) strange  
14:27 <tmortagne> sbaloul: I'm using Maven 3.0.5 and Java 1.6.0\_45  
14:27 <tmortagne> what exact versions are you using ?  
14:28 <tmortagne> what jvm are you using ? you said you were using Ubunu, are you using openjdk ?  
14:28 <tmortagne> I'm using the Oracle one  
14:28 <sbaloul> whefor java we have the same  
14:28 <sbaloul> but maven : Apache Maven 3.0.4  
14:29 <sbaloul> not 3.0.5  
14:29 <tmortagne> I doubt that's the reason  
14:29 <tmortagne> you have Oracle jvm 1.6.0\_45 on ubuntu ?  
14:29 <tmortagne> ubuntu 13.10 ?  
14:29 <sbaloul> yes  
14:31 <sbaloul> same version for ubuntu too  
14:31 <sbaloul> 13.10  
14:31 <cjd> probably something tmortagne setup and forgot about, eg env variables  
14:32 <tmortagne> cjd: no special env variable no  
14:32 <tmortagne> and nobody have the issue sbaloul have on various systems  
14:33 <cjd> hmm  
14:33 <tmortagne> what need to be understood is why you get http://hastebin.com/dowisukifo.avrasm  
14:34 <cjd> mmm  
14:34 <sbaloul> I don't know it affeter issuing release:perform  
14:35 <cjd> sudo tcpdump -A -s0 'host nexus.xwiki.org' 2>&1 | tee ./dump.txt  
14:35 <cjd> need to ctrl+c in that window after you're done trying to release  
14:36 <cjd> then grep the resulting file for "Bad Request"  
14:36 <cjd> then you'll at least know what the http req was  
14:38 <tmortagne> there is something that makes nexus think several different computer are deployed stuff with your user  
14:39 <cjd> computer === ip addr?  
14:39 <tmortagne> no idea what make a repo unique for nexus  
14:39 <tmortagne> it's not sessions that's for sure  
14:40 <tmortagne> what you deploy get cut in several repositories in nexus for some reason  
14:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/index.html#stagingProfiles;1199a47b8ff44eed  
14:41 <vmassol> AFAIU this is how the match is configured/done  
14:42 <vmassol> hover over the question mark  
14:42 <cjd> sbaloul: try going to http://www.whatismyip.com/ and hitting f5 a bunch of times, see if the number changes  
14:42 <cjd> maybe wait a minute then hit f5 again  
14:42 <vmassol> so if the profile id is not passed then it's computed based on user agent + ip + user name + repository target  
14:42 <vmassol> (AFAIU)  
14:42 <cjd> some kinds of nats might hand out one ip per tcp session  
14:42 <cjd> which would be kind of horrific and also kind of hilariously awesome depending on what you wanted to do :)  
14:42 <tmortagne> user name and repository target are not changing so we are left with ip or user agent  
14:43 <sbaloul> cjd: yes it's changing  
14:43 <vmassol> so if any of these changes, it'll be a new repo AFAIU: user agent, ip, username, repository and indeed I see only IP as something that can change  
14:43 <vmassol> user agent shouldn't change either but yes maybe  
14:43 <cjd> wow  
14:43 <cjd> that's amusing  
14:43 <cjd> he's got a wandering ip  
14:44 <tmortagne> not sure if you can indicate an explicit nexus profile id some way in maven pom.xml  
14:44 <vmassol> don't know either, never done it  
14:44 <tmortagne> I deleted the repositories, maybe the info was somewhere in them...  
14:45 <tmortagne> sbaloul could try another release :)  
14:45 <vmassol> "When using the Nexus Staging Maven Plugin for deployments, and therefore an explicitly defined staging profile in the project POM, the setting should be changed to Explicit Only"  
14:45 <vmassol> didn't know there was a maven plugin for nexus  
14:45 <tmortagne> that would indeed probably be nicer  
14:46 <vmassol> it would tie us more to nexus though  
14:46 <vmassol> and I'd like to move to artifactory at some point :)  
14:48 <tmortagne> ok  
14:49 <tmortagne> but maybe it's possible to pass an id some way with standard deploy plugin  
14:49 <tmortagne> just need to understand what nexus mean by id from HTTP point of view  
14:51 <vmassol> the simplest is just for sbaloul to fix his ip problem :)  
14:51 <vmassol> IMO there's nothing to do on our side  
14:51 <cjd> getting the ISP to change their equipment is going to be pulling teeth  
14:52 <cjd> and the alternative is VPN  
14:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: not sure it's that simple  
14:52 <tmortagne> I doubt he is the one doing it  
14:52 <vmassol> IMO it's a network config for the VM  
14:53 <tmortagne> I don't see how, nexus only see the public IP  
14:53 <cjd> oh, sbaloul are you releasing from a vm or from home?  
14:53 <tmortagne> cjd: from a vm in his computer, not a remote VM  
14:53 <cjd> ahh right  
14:53 <cjd> thatlldoit  
14:54 <sbaloul> not from a vm ? I've installed ubuntu on my computer  
14:54 <tmortagne> ok  
14:54 <tmortagne> I tough you said you would use ubuntu in the VM last time  
14:54 <cjd> On the bright side, there's no way to ban you from a website without banning your entire ISP :)  
14:54 <vmassol> :)  
14:55 <sbaloul> Yes, but I got some problems that foced me to install it rather using a vm  
14:55 <cjd> deleted windows?
